channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Nearly 2M Filipino tourist workers affected by COVID-pandemic — ILO report
item.author: Jeremaiah Opiniano
item.description: Nearly two million Filipino workers in the tourism sector 15.3 million tourist workers in Asia Pacific to be hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, says a United Nations agency's arm for the said geographic region.

item.title: Cayetano, other solons file 'new normal' bill amid COVID-19 pandemic
item.description: “The foreseeable re-opening of workplaces and businesses and the resumption of economic activity halted during the period of community quarantine cannot, however, simply proceed as if things can still go back to ‘normal,’” the solons noted.

item.title: Duterte wants FDA, DOST to increase workforce, operate 'day and night'
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The chief executive also wanted the two government agencies to extend their operations to 24 hours.

item.title: FULL TEXT: Duterte's April 27 talk to the people on COVID-19
item.description: Talk to the people of President Rodrigo Roa Duterte on coronavirus disease 2019

item.title: Locally made ventilator prototypes ready for testing on COVID-19 patients
item.description: Three locally designed ventilator prototypes are set to be tested on actual patients in intensive care units in an effort to produce more affordable versions of the hospital equipment to aid in the battle against the novel coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Senators eye amending rules to allow session teleconferencing
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Fifteen senators are seeking to amend Senate rules to dispense with the physical presence requirement in the holding of sessions and committee hearings, and allow teleconferencing in conducting legislative proceedings amid the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis.

item.title: ‘China not using COVID aid to deflect sea issue’
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. has defended China from accusations it is using its COVID-19 assistance to silence criticism of its aggression in the South China Sea.

item.title: Duterte to ASEAN: Establish early warning system for pandemics
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: President Duterte has called on his fellow Southeast Asian leaders to establish a regional early warning system for pandemics that immediately forewarns countries of imminent public health emergencies such as the coronavirus disease 2019, which has already killed over 200,000 people worldwide.

item.title: Former tourism chief Jimenez, 64
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: Former tourism secretary Ramon Jimenez Jr., who was responsible for the “It’s More Fun in the Philippines” campaign, has died from cardiac arrest. He was 64.

item.title: DBM checking uncommitted funds for possible realignment
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang is checking how much money from agency budgets can be realigned to its coronavirus disease 2019 response to determine if it needs to seek a supplemental budget from Congress.
